intro: Ardisia alyxiifolia, commonly known as the glossy wood sorrel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are edible for some animals but toxic to others. Ardisia alyxiifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks.
